From the Statesman's Mike Pence Ward: Texans 70 and older would not have to show a photo ID to vote. People without a driver's license could get a free state photo ID card to vote. And people could use their concealed-handgun licenses to vote. Those are among the provisions of a voter ID bill the Gov. Rick Perry Senate approved late Wednesday and sent to the House, where approval also is expected. But both supporters and opponents predicted Thursday that the proposal will be changed some more before it gains final approval.
